title.narrative: Integrated primary health care including prevention, detection and control of public health hazards, curative, maternal and child health, and EPI for vulnerable population in 7 states of Sudan

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to increase access to essential life-saving health interventions for the communities affected by worsening economic crisis in 19 targeted localities across 7 states of Sudan. WHO and partners will use CERF to procure and distribute essential medical supplies and equipment to 65 health facilities to provide integrated primary healthcare and referral services, scale up disease surveillance and outbreak control, and train local healthcare providers and community-based health volunteers. An estimated 320,000 people will benefit from this project, which will be implemented within six months.
